reviews.review:
Opposing Force was the only expansion pack to Half-Life that was really crtically acclaimed, and there's a good reason for that. To get this out of the way: this is a full game, not a short ripoff, and it remains Gearbox's best game to date in my opinion. Not only does it rival the original game, it remains a strong candidate for the best Half-Life game ever made. It's hard to believe that typically with an expansion pack, and the fact that was developed by another team just makes it even more unfathomable. However, Opposing Force gets everything right with Half-Life. 

Usually expansion packs don't end up being too special. They often do little else than add more content to a pre-existing game. Stand-alone expansions tend to fare better. Other examples of this type besides Opposing Force include Halo 3: ODST and Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon. 

Opposing Force doesn't screw up anything. The puzzle solving elements are still great. The platforming elements are still great. What it ultimately improves on besides just the visuals, and this is the main reason why it's so great, is combat and pacing. All of the new weapons are fun to use. There is not a single moment in this game that lacks tension or feels off, and in the end although it stands on its own it gets tied together with Half-Life very cohesively. This is what an expansion pack should be in a perfect world: something that goes beyond what it's expanding upon. And although most don't, this is an exception.
Opposing Force shows Half-Life from different perspective, and at the same time introduces a lot of new content and story. A decent add-on to the great game.
Куча нового оружия

Like the other Half-Life games, it is full of action, has a great story and is a decent game considering that it is 10+ years old.
I highly recommend it.
Classic and very addicting game.  Likely to suck you in for hours.
An excellent spinoff of half life, I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed half life 1. This one has more aliens and living guns that involve shoving your hand up something's ass.

Another beautiful sequel,of a beautiful game.
Play as Sgt.Shepard in the mission to kill the Freeman and save your life in a living hell in the Black Mesa Research Facility.
Be aware of all the Xen creatures that can kill you and your team mates,with a large arsenal of weapons,from the Wrench to the Sniper Rifle.
I really recommend this for who really loves Half-Life,because this sequel it's full of references from Half-Life.
8.5/10 A new airbreath for who loves Half-Life.
old game pretty good if you like FPS games

Much better than the oringinal Half-Life. Opposing Force offers a 6-8 hour long campaing filled with fun exicting adventures with all the elements, weapons and features of the original Half-life plus more.
Old, and still the best

Первое дополнение для Half-Life, разработанное Gearbox и выпущенное в 1999 году, через год после релиза оригинальный игры. Opposing Force рассказывает о военном подразделении HECU, прибывшее в Чёрную Мезу на зачистку свидетелей происшествия, а конкретно об Адриане Шепарде в звании капрал.
Сразу хочется сказать, что во многом оно превосходит оригинал и Blue Shift, потому что здесь помимо старых врагов появились новые  (так называемая Раса Х), новое вооружение (отчасти старое тоже осталось), в мультиплеере появился режим CTF (захват флага).
Рекомендую пройти всем, кого интересует вселенная Half-Life, хотелось бы продолжения этой истории. Точка ведь ещё не поставлена. Ну а так же ожидаем полноценный ремейк игры под названием Operation Black Mesa!
FUNER THAN U FREMANS

Cependant je le conseil, il vaut vraiment le coup, l'histoire est suivie et c'est trippant de retourné a black mesa, en incarnant l'un de ceux qui nous faisait bien chier quand on incarnait gordon freeman ^^

Otro gran juego de Gearbox ambientado en los lugares de half-life 1. Gran manera de entender un poquito mejor el misterio de la historia de Black Mesa y las consecuencias de sus experimentos, esta vez de la mano de Adrian Shepard, un militar cuya misión es destruir la incipiente raza Xen y callar a los supervivientes a cualquier precio. La acción y los breves momentos terroríficos, en la línea de su predecesor, hacen que este juego sea obligatorio para los amantes del half-life y muy recomendable para los amantes de la acción y los sobresaltos.

This is the first game created by Gearbox - the legendary developers behind Borderlands and Brothers in Arms. 

Opposing Forces is the first expansion to Half Life. Released in 1999, exactly a year after the original game.

Personally i like it just as much as the original Half Life, and in my book, original Half Life is in top 10.

It consists of 12 chapters, but don't let that fool you cause it's not nearly as long as the original Half Life. 6 hours is as much as you can get from it.

That said, the game has it's own identity. For example, just like any half life game, this one has a tutorial. Gearbox decided to have a bit of fun with it, since you start out in the boot camp.

It's a typical training mission, but a nicely done training mission. Had a lot of army stereotypes and FMJ references.

Unlike Blue Shift (2nd expansion), this game actually tried to add some things of its own.

[list]
    [*]Night vision googles instead of the flashlight.
    [*]Sniper instead of the crossbow.
    [*]Pistol with a laser pointer instead of the revolver.
    [*]Wrench and a knife instead of the crowbar
    [*]2 new alien weapons - one is like a bazooka, the other has infinite ammo (shoots lightning balls).
[*]Instead of long jumps, your protagonist climbs on ropes.
[*]1 new Black Mesa prototype weapon, that teleports you to Xen. The location you get teleported in generally have a lot of loot.
[*]1 completely new weapon, not just an alternative model - a machine gun (M249 SAW).
[*]There are new alien types as well.
[/list]

Also, throughout the game, you will encounter your comrades, the most important ones are medic and engineer. Medic can patch you up, while the engineer can drill through doors.

As for the story, neither Blue Shirt nor Opposing Forces are canon. That said, Opposing Forces has a lot of cameos. I personally wouldn't have minded to have it in the official lore.

Deep inside it's still the same game, but at least they tried to add a few things here and there. Like i said, it has it's own identity.

I highly recommend it.
One of my favorite FPS

Recommend playing [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006934852/recommended/70/]Half-Life[/url] first. Opposing Force was more enjoyable than the original, due in part to its shorter length. Re-visiting Black Mesa from a different perspective offers a gratifying sense of nostalgia. 

Made 20% more enjoyable when experienced alongside the very excellent [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR2vpfke_UnCkFRL1b5Vt2remuAZBt5y3]walkthrough[/url] by BigMacDavis.

Also recommened: the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006934852/recommended/130/]Blue Shift[/url] expansion.

Half-Life: Opposing Force - это качественно сделанное дополнение к всем известной Half-Life. Здесь нам предлагают посмотреть на инцидент в "Чёрной Мезе" глазами простого солдата сил HECU, каких мы пачками валили в оригинале. 
Добавленные в игру новые персонажи, оружие и противники прекрасно вписываются в общую сюжетную канву (чего только стоит Desert Eagle и Спорометатель), а финальная битва с боссом заставит Вас хорошенько попотеть...
В общем, Half-Life: Opposing Force - яркий, ОБРАЗЦОВО показательный пример того, как НАДО делать дополнения, а не как сейчас - В одном DLC скины для персов, в другом - карты для мультиплеера и т.д. Именно на такую, сделанную на совесть, не побоюсь этого слова, работу и должны равняться все разработчики. Всегда.
Рекомендую всем любителям хорошего сюжета и весёлых пострелушек.

Experience the game of Half Life though the eyes of Adrian Shepard. A military specialist who's mission is to eliminate Gordon Freeman and his fellow scientists, as well as bring down the Black Mesa facility complex. This game has the same weapons, and enemies again but with a different adventure. A little longer game than Blue Shift.

Where Blue Shift failed, this expansion succeeds. Gearbox did an excellent job with this one, with a ton of great new weapons and great new enemies to face. Once you're done with Half-Life 1, you've GOT to play this.
Ótimo jogo, adiciona varias armas e até novos inimigos que não tinham no primeiro half-life, mas tem alguns problemas com a inteligência artificial dos aliados e alguns bugs.

Another story line of Half Life.
Play it if you like Half Life series.

Wow wow wow,  Even thought I played the base half-life a long time ago this still impressed me.  With lots of new weapons, nightvison to replace that laser pointer flashlight and  a melee weapon that isn't useless in combat after you get a gun.   Not to mention lots of new weapons. I really see how they pushed the engine with this one with a grappleing hook like thing and Rope that you can swing on.   I can't really see this in half life 2, Valve can't get over telling us "Look at out physics engine! Look how things move in a near realistic way! Look how you can use your gravity gun to solve all your problems because thats what all our puzzles are based on!" Anything else? Oh yes, crossovers with the other parts of the game make me giddy  and it give a little to what g man is doing, Looks like valve Finaly desided what mysterious character  should be.

Anyways I recommend Getting this if you like either half life. More of the same but personally the best of it all.

07/10 A contrario de blue shift, opposing force est une véritable extention. Entre 4 et 6heures(selon difficultée) seront nécéssaire pour boucler la mission du caporal sheppard. Car ici nous n'incarnons pas Gordon Freeman mais un des mercenaires chargé de l'éliminer. Bien entendu rien ne se passera comme prévu. L'histoire est plutôt sympathique avec de petites scenettes s'imbriquant dans l'aventure principale. Mais c'est surtout au niveau du contenu proposé que opposing force étonne pour son époque : Shoots, enigmes, aventure,  plateformes avec un large éventail d'armes traditionelles comme plus originales servant autant à éradiquer les enemies que pour se frayer un chemin à travers les niveaux. Les intéractions avec les PNJ sont plutôt convaincantes, l'immersion est réussi. Cela dit quelques bugs et un gameplay parfois lourdingue viennent entacher le périple. Le tout bien entendu à relativiser. La premiere serie Half life à 15ans!!
A great addition to the Half-Life franchise.

The first expansion for Half-Life, which is also it's best in my opinion.

Challenging while retaining the spirit of Half-Life. The Soundtrack is also ambient and hectic.
Played from the perspective of Adrian Sheapard, part of the military team sent to deal with the Black Mesa incident, you get to fight the Xen aliens, but also a mysterious race of aliens known as X. The game adds a few new weapons, new monsters, and the level design is damn good.

The soundtrack is one of the best of the Half-Life 1 era games. Although Blue Shift uses the same soundtrack as Op4, Chris Jenson brings alot to the table. It easily matches Kelly Baileys original score.

Opposing Force is the best expansion for Half-Life. It's pretty lengthy, stretching over 9 hours. Blue Shift is also good, but the new weapons and monsters aren't there, and the length is considerablly shorter due to Barney's story. The Half-Life series is not complete without these expansions.

Half-Life: Opposing Force packs the same non-stop action as the original Half-Life, but this time playing from a new perspective: that of Adrian Shephard, a member of the military sent to "clean up" the Black Mesa Incident.

This game features some new weapons, and it shows more areas of the Black Mesa Research Facility. The story is as good as that of the original Half-Life, and you get to see things from the side of the HECU.

Although a bit shorter than Half-Life, this is a great game, and, in my opinion, it's slightly more challenging than its predecessor. Another highly recommended game.
Отличный шутер, который сначала прикидывается халф-лайфом, а потом набирает собственные обороты. Больше оружия, другая, пусть и не каноничная, раса, высокая сложность. Неплохо.

For a game made during the first stage of Valve's series, it holds up fine, and fits in with the rest of the other half lives made during this time (Half life, and Half life Blue Shift) I would recommend you buy the "Half life complete" Pack, if you want all of 'em, you'll save money.
That's not to say this doesn't work on its own, it's able to get into interesting gameplay, it's just better when you have the rest of the games made during this time period (Said games I already mentioned) it's able to give you a plot you can follow, and a training mode that, well, actually trains you for the game.
In all, the graphics are the same as the other half lives released, and the gameplay is too, (Modified a tad) I recommend it to those who enjoy all of the other games in the half life saga (NOT counting Deathmatch) as it focuses on story as much as gameplay and fighting. If you enjoyed half life 1, or half life blue shift, this should fit right into the spirit of its game-sibilings.
Атмосферность этой игры зашакаливает!

If you have played Half Life and liked it you will love this game. I played Black Mesa when i started getting into the Half Life series and it is amazing. Although Black Mesa's ending is some what different to Half LIfe's ending you can always youtube the rest of the story line.
